wikipedia_page.main: Major General Sir William Eyre  KCB (21 October 1805 – 18 September 1859) was an officer in the British Army.

response: * Eyre was named in 1872 for Major General Sir William Eyre (1805–59), who served with distinction in South Africa.
*Major-General Sir William Eyre KCB, commanded 3rd Brigade and later 3rd Division in the Crimean War; later Commander-in-Chief, North America

In 1858, Whitmore attended Staff College but withdrew from his studies on account of health issues. He was later sent to Canada for a time to serve as aide-de-camp to the General Officer Commanding, Canada, Major-General William Eyre. He was able to resume his studies in 1860 and graduated from Staff College with top marks.

link_mentions.page: Commander of the British Troops in Canada

response: The left column of 233 cavalry under Lieutenant-Colonel G.T.C. Napier of the Cape Mounted Rifles, made up of elements of the 12th Royal Lancers and the Cape Mounted Rifles, were to circumnavigate the Berea plateau to the east. The main column under Sir William Eyre were to cross the reamohetse sello′s plateau and the right column under Cathcart would skirt the plateau to the west.
*William Eyre (British Army officer) (1805–1859), British Army major general
